results.name: Sum of 7th powers of odd divisors of n.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. W. L. Glaisher, On the representations of a number as the sum of two, four, six, eight, ten, and twelve squares, Quart. J. Math. 38 (1907), 1-62 (see p. 4 and p. 8).
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Odd Divisor Function
Index entries for sequences mentioned by Glaisher
formula: a(n) = A013955(A000265(n)) = sigma_7(odd part of n); in particular, a(2^k) = 1 for all k >= 0. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 26 2018
mathematica: a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, #^7 &, OddQ[#] &]; Array[a, 20] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Dec 07 2018 *)
xref: Cf. A321543 - A321565, A321807 - A321836 for related sequences.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 24 2018
